description: Categorization of respondents into age brackets to analyze differences in voting intentions among different age categories.
Respondents' gender to assess voting preferences across male and female populations.
Highest level of education attained by respondents, used to examine correlations between education and voting preferences.
Classification of respondents based on NRS social grades (AB, C1, C2, DE) to evaluate voting trends across economic classes.
Current party preference or intention of respondents if a general election were held.
Respondents' voting behavior in the 2019 general election to analyze shifts in party support.
Voting behavior of respondents in the 2017 general election for comparing voting patterns over time.
Respondents' voting preference during the EU referendum, tracked to identify influences on current voting intentions.
